app_desc.message: Drag scrollbar with your middle mouse button anywhere on the page. Supports also "grab and drag" style.

o_axis_lock_helper.message: When scrolling a box that is scrollable in one axis but parent box is scrollable in other axis, lock scrolling to one axis using:

o_axis_lock_0.message: Smart lock - temporal lock using momentum

o_axis_lock_2.message: No lock - free scrolling in both axis

o_trend_momentum_window_helper.message: Larger value will require more scrolling in opposite axis to change the scrolling axis.

o_addon_disabled_warning.message: Addon is disabled! Click here to enable.

o_scroll_type_1.message: Grab and Drag - like on a smartphone

o_scroll_type_title_1.message: It's like dragging a page with your finger on a phone screen

o_scroll_type_title_2.message: Dynamic Speed makes scroll speed slower when page is longer

o_disable_key.message: Disable / Enable scrolling when key is down:

o_momentum_formula_type_title_0.message: Page scroll will be uniformly slowed down until it stops

o_momentum_formula_type_title_1.message: Page scroll will rapidly (exponentially) slow down

o_advanced_momentum_title.message: Changing these values can break your momentum!

o_prevent_big_jumps_helper.message: If you are using tool that can teleport your cursor across the screen (when you reach an edge), enable this option to allow continuous (infinite) scrolling.

o_helper_text_move_detection.message: How many pixels has to mouse move to block link. Sometimes when pressing scroll button you move mouse slightly but you don't want the link to be disabled because of that.

o_context_menu_unblock_delay_helper.message: If you see context menu after scrolling with Right mouse button, increase this value

o_is_disabled_url_help.message: You can use star symbol (*) to define a URL part, for example: "google.com/maps*"

o_toolbar_button_main_switch.message: Use toolbar icon as the main ON / OFF switch

o_scroll_button_right_linux_note.message: Linux / Mac users - you will be prompted for new permission "Read and modify browser setting" - this is required to suppress context menu being shown before scrolling!

o_scroll_button_right_linux_chrome_note.message: Linux / Mac users - your context menu will be blocked! To open context menu hold "Shift" key or triple-click right button.

o_scroll_on_links_title.message: When enabled, you won't be able to drag and drop links (only by using 'Disable' key)

o_scroll_on_text_title.message: Emulates phone scrolling / editing - you need to click on text in order to switch to "editing mode". Clicking outside of text enables scrolling again.

o_scroll_on_textarea_title.message: Textarea is a block of text, usually resizable. For example on "Disabled on" tab you can see textarea.

o_scroll_on_editable_html_title.message: For example email body in Gmail is editable html.

o_scroll_on_text_edit_with.message: on text will enable selecting / editing text.

o_scroll_on_text_edit_with_title.message: Click on text will enable "Edit mode". Click outside text to enable "Scroll mode".

o_momentum.message: enable momentum - you can "throw" the page (like on phone)

o_no_css_edit.message: Don't lock iframes and don't change cursor when scrolling

o_no_link_block.message: Don't block mouse click on link after movement

o_helper_text_middle_link_click.message: When you start scrolling on a link and then you finish scrolling on the same link, browser will open the link. This is usually not desired behaviour so by default it's blocked.

o_page_weight_title.message: This controls how 'heavy' the page is. Heavier pages has longer momentum.

o_additional_speed_title.message: You can accelerate momentum stating speed.

o_compute_from_last_title.message: Momentum initial speed is determined by the speed of scrolling right before releasing the Scroll button.

o_mouse_stop_detection_title.message: How much time has to mouse stay still - before releasing the Scroll button - to NOT activate Momentum.

o_tracking_speed_title.message: Interval for measuring current scroll speed.

o_outside_area_width_helper.message: Moving your cursor outside of scrolling area will revert scrolling position. Same behavior can be seen when dragging a scrollbar.

o_scroll_button_left_title.message: Warning - Left button support is using deprecated Firefox API that could be removed in future versions of Firefox.

o_prevent_text_selection.message: Prevent text selection when scrolling with left button

o_helper_text_prevent_text_selection.message: On some devices, scrolling with left mouse button will also select text on the page.

o_disable_context_menu_on_move.message: Don't block context menu when trying to scroll not-scrollable page

not_working_title.message: Your browser will block $app_name$ on these type of pages:

not_working_body.message: To enable $app_name$ on "mozilla.org" pages, see this YouTube tutorial

o_helper_text_performance_iframe.message: If you experience noticeable delay between pressing scroll button and starting scrolling, try to enable this option. However you will not be able to scroll over "iframes" such as some old embedded videos or some ads.

o_helper_text_performance_cursor.message: This will also disable option to change cursor while scrolling.

o_helper_text_default_action.message: Useful in Linux to enable Paste with middle button.

o_about_intro.message: My name is $1$ and I'm the author of $app_name$.

o_about_like_it.message: If you like it, please rate it here:

o_about_dislike_it.message: If you don't like it, please let me know why to my e-mail. I'm implementing most of the feature-requests I receive.

o_about_support_by.message: Please consider supporting my work by

o_about_support_reply.message: I can reply only in English / Slovak

o_paste_with_middle.message: Use middle click to "paste" content of the clipboard

o_allow_other_mouse_down_handlers.message: Allow other "mousedown" event handlers while scrolling
